Working directly within the Materials Engineering group, this position is responsible for managing the development, qualification, and delivery of all internal and external plastic injection molding tools from preliminary design review to launch. The ideal candidate will bring a proactive, solutions-oriented mindset to drive seamless coordination and communication between design, engineering, and production teams, to ensure tools are delivered on time and meet the required quality and performance standards.

A background in injection molding tool design, risk analysis, and performance tracking in high-volume manufacturing environments is essential, as is the ability to collaborate effectively with both internal teams and external suppliers to ensure the successful deployment of tools. Act as the main liaison between design, internal/external tool makers, and production teams to ensure seamless communication and collaboration and achieve program milestones and deliverables.
Develop, maintain, and implement comprehensive program tracking plans and strategies to drive successful tool builds and production readiness.
Plan and prioritize effectively to meet organization goals, ensuring accountability of each team member in the project.
Manage and drive the entire program timeline, ensuring all internal and external insource tools are delivered on time while meeting quality and performance expectations.
Lead risk analysis efforts using DFMEA, PFMEA and past program lessons-learned to proactively identify and mitigate risks. Develop and implement contingency plans to address potential roadblocks.
Own the change ticket process, ensuring proper creation, tracking, and execution of design or process modifications and hand-offs.
Interface with key stakeholders to ensure alignment on scope, expectations, milestones, and deadlines. Facilitate regular cross-functional team collaboration tag-ups to drive an efficiency in both internal and external tool build processes. Ensure all teams are fully briefed and working toward the common goal of successful tool deployment.
Establish and track KPIs for internal/external tool build processes. Analyze trends and outliers, proposing corrective actions to improve performance. Conduct post-program evaluations, summarizing effectiveness, punctuality, customer satisfaction, and lessons learned.
Communicate periodic progress reports to key stakeholders and leadership and proactively escalate risks, providing data-driven recommendations for resolution.

Bachelors degree in engineering or STEM
5+ years of professional experience as a program manager

10+ years of experience in injection mold design and/or injection mold construction
Project management professional (PMP) certified
Detailed understanding of plastics molding-related process variables and their impact on throughput, quality, and yield rate
Strong to expert-level 3D CAD skills, including advanced surfacing and large assemblies
Siemens NX fluency or must be able to learn and adopt it quickly as it will be the design package used (NX 2306)

Strong experience in setting up and performing detailed mold simulations (Autodesk Moldflow)

The EEE (electrical, electronic, and electro-mechanical/electro-optical) parts reliability team at SpaceX is a multidisciplinary group dedicated to ensuring the reliability of high-performance 38999 (and similar) connectors and flight components, including integrated circuits, discrete semiconductors, and passive hardware.
As a member of the EEE parts reliability team, the EEE component engineer plays a critical role in ensuring the selection of reliable, cost-effective components across our programs. This person will be responsible for evaluating new and existing components through communicating with suppliers, reviewing qualification reports and performing hands-on physical teardowns. Additionally, they will be responsible for maintaining compliance with certification requirements and interacting with customers.
The ideal candidate is familiar with piece part families and common quality/reliability defects; is adept at using analysis tools for characterizing life expectancy of electronic hardware; articulates risk assessments clearly to customers; and collaborates well with cross-functional teams of varying backgrounds and levels of experience.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
